name: quassel-web
description: [{{ project_name|capitalize }}]({{ project_url }}) is a web client for Quassel.  Note that a Quassel-Core instance is required, we have a container available [here.](https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/quassel-core/)

env.description: specify the URL or IP address of your Quassel Core instance
specify the port of your Quassel Core instance
Specify a url-base in reverse proxy setups ie. `/quassel`

volumes.description: this will store config on the docker host

readme-vars.project_blurb: [{{ project_name|capitalize }}]({{ project_url }}) is a web client for Quassel.  Note that a Quassel-Core instance is required, we have a container available [here.](https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/quassel-core/)

param_volumes.desc: this will store config on the docker host

param_env_vars.desc: specify the URL or IP address of your Quassel Core instance
specify the port of your Quassel Core instance

opt_param_env_vars.desc: Specify a url-base in reverse proxy setups ie. `/quassel`

readme-vars.app_setup_block:
By default this container webui will be available on `https://$SERVER_IP:64443`. To setup this container you can either use the envrionment variables we recommend or manually setup the configuration file by leaving out the `QUASSEL_CORE` environment variable among others. 
The configuration file using this method can be found at:
```
/config/settings-user.js
```

setup:
By default this container webui will be available on `https://$SERVER_IP:64443`. To setup this container you can either use the envrionment variables we recommend or manually setup the configuration file by leaving out the `QUASSEL_CORE` environment variable among others. 
The configuration file using this method can be found at:
```

```
title: Quassel Web
